intro: Erioneuron avenaceum var. cabrerae, commonly known as the Canary Island grass, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown flowers, typical of many grass species. It thrives in coastal and rocky habitats, showing adaptability to arid and saline conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the island's native vegetation.
